column1: Name / Description

[tut_desc name="Introduction to the Half-Life Model Viewer (HLMV)" desc="In this tutorial i will explain to the best of my knowledge how to use HLMV for viewing and editing models" link="http://www.sourcemodding.com/tutorials/source/modeling/intro-to-hlmv-source/" /]

[tut_desc name="TF2 Custom Eyes in 3DS Max" desc="Creating custom eyes in 3DSMAX for TF2" link="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=5_ATRl1twEE" download_link="https://mega.nz/#F!VBhyDRBS!fA13Q3sncmzt7jCNYFmYDg" /]

[tut_desc name="TF2 Facial Morphs in 3DS Max" desc="How to work with TF2 facial morphs in 3DSMAX" link="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=U_-4HjXH97U" download_link="https://mega.nz/#F!xZ4mnLCQ!3u8GY2xf2kX6mpDffpm26A" /]

[tut_desc name="Quick compilation of QC files using the Explorer 'Send To' dropdown dialog" desc="If you want to quickly compile a model by just right clicking on the QC and selecting an option to compile it, then you're in the right place! " link="http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=492350894" /]
[tut_desc name="SoftImage - Moving Around the Viewports" desc="This is a short article describing the 2 options for moving around the viewports." link="http://articles.thewavelength.net/516/" /]
[tut_desc name="SoftImage - Creating You First Character" desc="Here is how to create your first character in SOFTIMAGE|XSI." link="http://articles.thewavelength.net/508/" /]

[tut_desc name="Attachments " desc="There are two reasons to use attachments. The first was touched on in the Point_Viewcontrol tutorial here, where you can set the PVC to always point at a particular feature on an NPC, Alyx's eyes in the tutorial." link="http://web.archive.org/web/20141005115112/http://www.halfwit-2.com/?page=resources&action=view&item=14" /]

[tut_desc name="HL2 Model List" desc="A full listing of HL2 models by directory" link="http://web.archive.org/web/20060618113058/http://halfwit-2.com/?page=resources&action=view&item=1&PHPSESSID=d50bbc8e15612551d0eb10d5f6efb683" /]
[tut_desc name="Adding an HL2 Custom Sequence" desc="How to add a custom sequence to an existing model" link="https://twhl.info/wiki/page/Tutorial%3A_Adding_an_HL2_Custom_Sequence" /]

[tut_desc name="Animating Models" desc="Rigging and animation for Source models, using XSI." link="https://twhl.info/wiki/page/Tutorial%3A_Animating_Models" download_link="https://mega.nz/#F!Jd4V1KaJ!5LkcAH1IF64fd2K4i5lyLw" /]

[tut_desc name="First XSI Model" desc="Guides you through creating your first Source mode in XSI." link="https://twhl.info/wiki/page/Tutorial%3A_First_XSI_Model" download_link="https://mega.nz/#F!McwHWD5A!ljy6ZacJdNEymhnnhHZ7JA" /]

[tut_desc name="Rescaling Prop Models" desc="You can't use Model Viewer to do it anymore. This covers rescaling prop models for Source." link="https://twhl.info/wiki/page/Tutorial%3A_Rescaling_Prop_Models" /]
[tut_desc name="Source Modelling Setup" desc="Configuring XSI and using the SDK tools" link="https://twhl.info/wiki/page/Tutorial%3A_Source_Modelling_Setup" /]

[tut_desc name="Creating a 'prop_physics entity'" desc="I will guide you through the creation of a prop_physics entity, which may also be used as a prop_static entity." link="http://web.archive.org/web/20071127125604/http://www.gamedesign.net/node/1002" /]

[tut_desc name="Adding Extra Skins to Existing Models" desc="Describes how to add extra skins to existing compiled models in the Source engine" link="http://www.snarkpit.net/snarkpower/articles/game/cat/pn/tp/194/Adding_Extra_Skins_to_Existing_Models" /]
[tut_desc name="Creating and compiling basic models" desc="Getting started" link="http://www.snarkpit.net/snarkpower/articles/game/cat/pn/tp/169/Creating_and_compiling_basic_models" /]

[tut_desc name="Modeling: Getting Started with XSI" desc="Get everything set up for your first model!" link="http://www.snarkpit.net/snarkpower/articles/game/cat/pn/tp/167/Modeling:_Getting_Started_with_XSI" /]

[tut_desc name="Digital Tutors - Softimage 7.5 Training" desc="Training kit originally provided for free by Digital Tutors and Autodesk to train those learning Sodtimage XSI" link="https://mega.nz/#F!gZhFzZja!4w8BbHm1GEFg_5_xenkAHA" /]

[tut_desc name="Writing a basic QC file" desc="This is not a tutorial of such, more of a reference and is only an introduction to the QC file." link="http://www.snarkpit.net/snarkpower/articles/game/cat/pn/tp/148/Writing_a_basic_QC_file" /]
[tut_desc name="Custom Props Part 1" desc="Modelling in Milkshape " link="http://www.snarkpit.net/snarkpower/articles/game/cat/pn/tp/142/Custom_Props:_Part_1" /]
[tut_desc name="Source Model Compile/Decompile Flowchart" desc="A quick reference for source model compiling and decompiling. Includes links. " link="http://the303.org/tutorials/index.html" /]

[tut_desc name="Mario\'s Guide to Ragdolling" desc="Gmod Ragdolling with 3dmax" link="https://web.archive.org/web/20110401001456/http://www.facepunch.com/threads/542906-Mario-s-Guide-To-Ragdolling?p=10073132#post10073132" /]

[tut_desc name="How to make a prop in XSI for HL2" desc="How to construct a prop in XSI, texture it, export it & compile to .mdl format and put in-game!" link="https://www.moddb.com/games/half-life/tutorials/how-to-make-a-prop-in-xsi-for-hl2" /]
